verses.text: To you I call, O LORD my Rock; do not turn a deaf ear to me. For if you remain silent, I will be like those who have gone down to the pit.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:1
rsbNotes.text:
28:1 my rock. Using this familiar name the psalmist remembers God as his source of protection and strength (Deut. 32:4, 18, 31; Ps. 78:35).

go down to the pit. That is, to die. The pit stands for Sheol, the grave (6:5 note).

verses.text: Hear my cry for mercy as I call to you for help, as I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:2
rsbNotes.text: 28:2 holy sanctuary. The Most Holy Place, the inner room in the tabernacle or temple where the ark of the covenant stood.

verses.text: Do not drag me away with the wicked, with those who do evil, who speak cordially with their neighbors but harbor malice in their hearts.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:3
rsbNotes.text: 28:3 speak peace. The psalmist knows the hypocrisy of his enemies.

verses.text: Repay them for their deeds and for their evil work; repay them for what their hands have done and bring back upon them what they deserve.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:4
rsbNotes.text: 28:4 render them. An imprecation, that is, a prayer that God would punish the enemy.

verses.text: Since they show no regard for the works of the LORD and what his hands have done, he will tear them down and never build them up again.
Praise be to the LORD, for he has heard my cry for mercy.
The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and I am helped. My heart leaps for joy and I will give thanks to him in song.
The LORD is the strength of his people, a fortress of salvation for his anointed one.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:5
rsbNotes.text: 28:5 he will tear them down. The previous verse appealed for judgment and this one pronounces it.

verses.text: Save your people and bless your inheritance; be their shepherd and carry them forever.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 28:9
rsbNotes.text:
28:9 your people. The psalmist broadens his appeal to the Lord to include the whole nation.

Be their shepherd. See note Ps. 23:1.
